ByteImage C only
[Class ByteImage]

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999. More...

Functions

UINT32 kB_GetPixel (int x, int y, const TImage *pInfo)
 Returns a pixel value at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

UINT32 kB_GetPixelFast (int x, int y, const TImage *pInfo)
 Returns a pixel value at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

bool kB_SetPixel (int x, int y, UINT32 Color, TImage *pInfo)
 Sets a pixel at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

bool kB_SetPixelFast (int x, int y, UINT32 Color, TImage *pInfo)
 Sets a pixel at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

float kB_GetPixelInterpolated (float x, float y, const TImage *pInfo)
 For graytone images only, needs 1,4 and 8 b/p, produces an error in other cases.

float kB_GetPixelInterpolatedFast (float x, float y, const TImage *pInfo)
 A faster version of k_GetPixelInterpolated(), no checking of b/p and origo must be (0,0).

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999.

Basic ByteImage functions to be used as stand alone c functions only. The C++ part does not use these functions.

Version:
1.00
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

float kB_GetPixelInterpolated (  float    x,
float    y,
const TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

For graytone images only, needs 1,4 and 8 b/p, produces an error in other cases.

Uses bilinar interpolation.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction
y  The position in vertical direction
Returns :
interpolated pixel value

bool kB_SetPixel (  int    x,
int    y,
UINT32    Color,
TImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Sets a pixel at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
Color  The new pixel value, a palette index value.
Returns :
false if outside image or if b/p is not supported.
